title: 108_hr3605
content: The Act titled "Governmental Pension Plan Equalization Act of 2003" clarifies definitions related to "governmental plan". The "Governmental Pension Plan Equalization Act of 2003" amends the Internal Revenue Code and the Employee Retirement Income Security Act to include plans established by Indian tribal governments or entities wholly owned or controlled by them under the definition of a governmental plan. The term 'governmental plan' includes plans for employees of Indian tribal governments, subdivisions, agencies, or entities wholly owned or controlled by them under tribal, Federal, or State law. SEC. 3. Extension of current moratorium on nondiscrimination rules to all governmental plans. The text chunk discusses amendments to sections of the Internal Revenue Code related to governmental plans, specifically regarding the removal of certain language and the updating of headings for clarity. Amendment made to Section 401(k)(3)(G) of the Internal Revenue Code for governmental plans. SEC. 4 clarifies that tribal governments must adhere to the same defined benefit plan rules as state and local governments, including their police and firefighters. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include changes for police, firefighters, and state and local government plans, now also applicable to Indian tribal governments. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include changes for police, firefighters, state, local, and Indian tribal government plans. Additionally, amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 address contributions by units of government. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 now include provisions for Indian tribal government employee benefit plans. The amendments made by this Act will apply to years before, on, or after the enactment date.
